Articles.Content:
I have yet to post on these forums, so I decided to do so. I just tried to land on minimus, I found a nice unbelievably flat surface..I decided to land in it. Here are the pictures.

> ![1YQaz.png](http://i.imgur.com/1YQaz.png)
> I also don\'t get what that water looking liquid or stuff is, possibly ice? I went in to figure out what it was
> 
> ![kcPgy.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/kcPgy.jpg)
> 
> my lander began to sank, panicing, I tried to disconnect from the lander and launch off into orbit
> 
> ![qL7ZA.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/qL7ZA.jpg)
> 
> nope.jpg...

I was unable to land on minimus..I sunk into that mud..liquid mix....

Time to build a craft capable of rescue.

That\'s hysterical. You fell victim to Minmus\'s notoriously out-of-whack terrain colliders. That is supposed to be solid ice. 

Now i kinda wish it was supposed to be a muddy sludge.
Yeah, I\'m not dead though I can only keep it up there though.

I reloaded the vessel via space center

> ![yMfGh.png](http://i.imgur.com/yMfGh.png)

I didn\'t want to take off again anyway.
Ooh! It would be cool if the 'frozen' lakes would thaw out in the day time, then refreeze at night.

This almost happened to me, too. As my lander legs started sinking into what I wasn\'t sure if it was ground, I almost legged it. But I didn\'t, and for me it happened to turn out fine. I thought the lakes were supposed to be wet, snowy sludge.
